title: Gerard Bertheloot
text:
Gerard Bertheloot (5 January 1906 – 5 October 1950) was a Belgian <a href="middle-distance%20running">middle-distance runner</a>. He competed in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201928%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20800%20metres">men's 800 metres</a> at the <a href="1928%20Summer%20Olympics">1928 Summer Olympics</a>.
Biography.
Bertheloot was born in <a href="Rollegem-Kapelle">Rollegem-Kapelle</a> in <a href="West%20Flanders">West Flanders</a> in 1908. He moved to <a href="Kortrijk">Kortrijk</a>, where he was employed in a bicycle factory. 
 He appears to have been a member of the <a href="K.A.A.%20Gent">Union Sportive Gantoise</a> athletics club in <a href="Ghent">Ghent</a>.
In 1928, Bertheloot competed in the <a href="1928%20Summer%20Olympics">Olympic Games</a> which were held in Amsterdam. Bertheloot ran in the 1st heat of the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201928%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20800%20metres">men's 800 metres</a>, which was held on 29 July 1928 at the <a href="Olympic%20Stadium%20%28Amsterdam%29">Olympic Stadium</a>. He finished in fifth place, behind <a href="Guus%20Zeegers">Guus Zeegers</a> of the Netherlands and ahead of <a href="Vasileios%20Stavrinos">Vasileios Stavrinos</a>, who was competing for Greece.
Bertheloot died without having children, at the age of 44 on 5 October 1950.
